verses.kjv: My son, if thou be surety for thy friend, if thou hast stricken thy hand with a stranger,
verses.ct: My son, if you have guaranteed a loan for your friend, if you have shaken hands to pledge yourself for a stranger,

verses.kjv: Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth, thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.
verses.ct: then you are trapped by your own words — caught by the promises you made.

verses.kjv: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, when thou art come into the hand of thy friend; go, humble thyself, and make sure thy friend.
verses.ct: So do this right away, my son, and free yourself, since you are now at your friend's mercy: go, swallow your pride, and plead urgently with your friend.

verses.kjv: Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.
verses.ct: Don't let yourself sleep or even rest your eyes.

verses.kjv: Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.
verses.ct: Free yourself like a deer escaping a hunter, like a bird breaking loose from a trapper.

verses.kjv: Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:
verses.ct: Go watch the ant, you lazy person; study how it lives, and learn something:

verses.kjv: Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler,
verses.ct: It has no commander, no supervisor, and no boss,

verses.kjv: Provideth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.
verses.ct: yet it stores up its food during the summer and gathers its supplies at harvest time.

verses.kjv: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?
verses.ct: How long are you going to lie there, you lazy person? When will you finally get up?

verses.kjv: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:
verses.ct: "Just a little more sleep, a little more rest, just folding my hands for a quick nap" —

verses.kjv: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth, and thy want as an armed man.
verses.ct: and poverty will come at you like a drifter, and need will hit you like an armed attacker.

verses.kjv: A naughty person, a wicked man, walketh with a froward mouth.
verses.ct: A worthless, wicked person goes around speaking dishonestly.

verses.kjv: He winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;
verses.ct: He signals with his eyes, communicates with his feet, and points with his fingers —

verses.kjv: Frowardness is in his heart, he deviseth mischief continually; he soweth discord.
verses.ct: his heart is full of twisted motives. He constantly plots evil and stirs up conflict.

verses.kjv: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; suddenly shall he be broken without remedy.
verses.ct: Because of this, disaster will strike him without warning; in an instant he will be shattered beyond repair.

verses.kjv: These six things doth the LORD hate: yea, seven are an abomination unto him:
verses.ct: There are 6 things the LORD hates — actually 7 that he finds disgusting:

verses.kjv: A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,
verses.ct: arrogant eyes, a tongue that lies, and hands that murder innocent people,

verses.kjv: An heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief,
verses.ct: a mind that schemes up evil plans, feet that rush eagerly toward wrongdoing,

verses.kjv: A false witness that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.
verses.ct: a witness who pours out lies, and anyone who stirs up conflict among brothers.

verses.kjv: My son, keep thy father’s commandment, and forsake not the law of thy mother:
verses.ct: My son, hold on to your father's instructions, and don't abandon your mother's teaching.

verses.kjv: Bind them continually upon thine heart, and tie them about thy neck.
verses.ct: Keep them tied close to your heart at all times; fasten them around your neck.

verses.kjv: When thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.
verses.ct: When you walk, they will guide you; when you sleep, they will watch over you; and when you wake up, they will speak to you.

verses.kjv: For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:
verses.ct: For these instructions are a lamp, this teaching is a light, and corrective discipline is the path to life.

verses.kjv: To keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.
verses.ct: They will protect you from an immoral woman, from the smooth talk of a seductive stranger.

verses.kjv: Lust not after her beauty in thine heart; neither let her take thee with her eyelids.
verses.ct: Don't desire her beauty in your heart, and don't let her captivate you with her flirtatious glances.

verses.kjv: For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread: and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.
verses.ct: A prostitute will reduce you to a scrap of bread, and an adulteress will hunt for your very soul.

verses.kjv: Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?
verses.ct: Can someone carry fire against his chest without his clothes catching flame?

verses.kjv: Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned?
verses.ct: Can someone walk across burning coals without scorching his feet?

verses.kjv: So he that goeth in to his neighbour’s wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent.
verses.ct: That's what happens to anyone who sleeps with his neighbor's wife; no one who touches her will escape punishment.

verses.kjv: Men do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;
verses.ct: People don't look down on a thief if he steals to feed himself when he's starving;

verses.kjv: But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house.
verses.ct: but if he's caught, he must pay back 7 times as much — he may have to hand over everything he owns.

verses.kjv: But whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding: he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul.
verses.ct: But a man who commits adultery has no sense at all; whoever does this destroys his own soul.

verses.kjv: A wound and dishonour shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.
verses.ct: He will get wounds and disgrace, and his shame will never be erased.

verses.kjv: For jealousy is the rage of a man: therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.
verses.ct: For jealousy fuels a husband's fury, and he will show no mercy when he takes revenge.

verses.kjv: He will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.
verses.ct: He won't accept any compensation; he won't be satisfied no matter how many gifts you offer.
